TEI.2.document_title: S Rhoads Fisher to Stephen F Austin, 02-01-1832

barker_notes.barker_summary: S. Rhoads Fisher to Austin, February 2, 1832. Land. Collections.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 745

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*S. Rhoads Fisher to Austin, February 2, 1832. Land. Collections.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Matagorda */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="02-01-1832">Feby 1,1832*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col: S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*My dear Sir I wrote you a few lines by *person_mentioned*Mr: Jaques*/person_mentioned*, mentioning my arrival: We are still entirely in an unsettled state; and I therefore cannot do myself the pleasure to see you. I wrote you from the *location_mentioned*U States*/location_mentioned* respecting my land business which I am satisfied your goodness will have promptly attended to. I have now to ask you agreeably to your promise, to send me a power to vote upon your two shares of the *location_mentioned*Matagorda Town tract*/location_mentioned*. Let me ask you if you have received your quota of the notes arising from the sale of the lots thereof, as I understand there has been a division, tho' I have received nothing. I should very much like to know when you start for *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned*, tho' I hope you may deem it most advisable to remain this season in your own *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. Rhoads Fisher*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Should *person_mentioned*Mr. Lesassier*/person_mentioned* not have sent me the money that I wrote for, I wish you my Dear Sir to urge him on the subject, as it is absolutely essential I should have it.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. R. F.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
